content_lock:dialogue.new_version.title: Patch Notes
content_lock:dialogue.new_version.0322:
Content Lock 0.322 

 - Added new dialogue to inform players about the new version 
 - Added a new tutorial 
 - Added a welcome message for first time players 
 - Changed the recipe for Death Rider Summoning Potion 
 - Added new loot consisting of gold and gold blocks to Death Rider 
 - Added a respawn timer when dying during a boss fight 
 - Fixed a bug where players wouldn't go into spectator mode during boss fight 
 - Added a soul sand glass recipe
content_lock:dialogue.new_version.0323:
Content Lock 0.323 

 - Reworked spell system 
 - Added a new craftable spell: Fireball Spellbook
 - Changed most sounds to mono, which allows for some sounds to make use of directional audio
content_lock:dialogue.new_version.0324:
Content Lock 0.3.24 

 - Changed the naming convention for versions from x.xx to x.xx.xx 
 - Removed the ability for spells to be enchanted with material specific enchantments as well as knockback 
 - Spectating player now teleports back to boss if they go too far away 
 - Added unbreaking to enchantments loot table 
 - Fixed a bug where players could duplicate enchantments and some items using underground ponds 
 - Fixed curse of binding increasing the player weight instead of decreasing it 
 - Slightliy increased the effectiveness of breach enchantment 
 Added support for the lunge enchantment 
 - Fixed the lightning being too dim in the Nether 
 - Added a new advancement tab: Content Lock, for progression related advancements 
 - Added new advancements to guide players through the progression of the datapack 
 - Changed the name of Bottle 'o Enchanting to Experience Bottle 
 - Changed the furncace recipe to require furnace 
 - Iron Guardian now drops a furnace on death 
 - Enchanted Witch now drops an Alchemical Extractor on death 
 - Alchemical Wart can now be picked up only using an Alchemical Extractor 
 - Added multiple new advancements and relocated old ones, to guide players better
content_lock:dialogue.begin.title: Content Lock
content_lock:dialogue.begin.line1:
Welcome to Content Lock! 
 This datapack modifies Minecraft's progression to make it more challenging and rewarding. Prepare yourself for a unique adventure as you navigate through new mechanics, bosses, enchantments and much more. 
 
 This is a very extensive datapack, so make sure to check out your advancements to get familiar with new features and progression path. 
 Good luck, and have fun!
content_lock:dialogue.begin.tutorial_des: Open the tutorial to help you get started
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.title: Content Lock's Tutorial
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page1.tex:
Welcome to Content Lock! This tutorial will guide you through the key features and mechanics of the datapack to help you get started on your adventure. 

1. Progression System: Content Lock introduces a unique progression system that requires you to complete specific tasks and challenges to unlock new areas, items, and abilities. Keep an eye on your advancements to track your progress.

2. Boss Fights: Prepare for epic boss battles that will test your skills and strategy. Each boss has its own mechanics and attack patterns, so be sure to study them carefully before engaging in combat.

3. Enchantments and Upgrades: Discover new enchantments and upgrade paths for your gear. Experiment with different combinations to find the perfect setup for your playstyle.

4. New Mechanics: Content Lock adds various new mechanics, such as stamina management, enemy scaling, and environmental hazards. Adapt your strategies to overcome these challenges.

5. Exploration: The world of Content Lock is filled with hidden secrets, treasures, and brand new structures. Take your time to explore every nook and cranny to uncover all that the datapack has to offer.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page2.tex:
Part 1: Progression System

The progression system in Content Lock is designed to provide a structured yet flexible path for players to follow. Here are some key aspects of the progression system:

1. Advancement Tracking: Your progress is tracked through advancements, which can be accessed via the in-game advancements menu. These advancements will guide you through the various stages of the datapack and provide goals to work towards.

2. Unlocking New Content: As you complete advancements, you'll unlock new areas, items, and abilities. This encourages exploration and experimentation with different playstyles.

3. Difficulty Scaling: The difficulty of enemies and challenges will scale based on your progression. This ensures that the game remains challenging and engaging throughout your journey.

4. Resource Management: Certain resources may become more scarce or valuable as you progress, requiring you to adapt your strategies for gathering and utilizing them effectively.

5. Replayability: The progression system is designed to encourage multiple playthroughs, with different paths and choices leading to unique experiences each time you play.

6. Multiplayer: Content Lock is designed to be enjoyed in both single-player and multiplayer settings. The progression system will adapt to accommodate multiple players, ensuring a balanced and engaging experience for all participants.

By understanding and embracing the progression system, you'll be well-equipped to tackle the challenges that Content Lock has in store for you. The next page will delve into the basics of progression and how to get started.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page3.tex:
Tools: 

 All of the tools in Content Lock can break all of the blocks that given type of tool can mine from the very beggining, removing the need to upgrade them for mining purposes. All of them also share rougly the same dps, meaning that upgrades are mostly sidegrades, which give you different utility or stats rather than just more damage.

Upgrading Tools: 

 To upgrade your tools, you'll need to use a smithing table along with the appropriate upgrade item as well as matching Upgrade Template and material. Simply place your tool along with mentioned items in the smithing table to apply the upgrade. Each upgrade doesn't change much, besides allowing for different enchants to be applied to given tool and changing both attack speed and damage as well as durability. Be sure to experiment with different upgrades to find the perfect combination for your playstyle.

Upgrade Templates: 

 Upgrade Templates are special items that allow your tools to be upgraded to another type in the path of your choosing. Each template corresponds to a specific upgrade path and material type. The upgrade paths go like this: 
 - Wood->Copper/Stone/Chainmail, 
 - Copper->Gold->Diamond, 
 - Stone/Chainmail->Iron->Netherite. 
 Each path has it's own quirks so make sure to use the correct template when upgrading your tools to ensure compatibility and unlock the desired benefits.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page3.smi: Smithing Table is used to upgrade your tools using Upgrade Templates and appropriate materials. It can be crafted using 4 wooden planks and 2 iron ingots.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page3.sto: Chainmail, Stone and Copper Upgrades can be obtained by blowing up stone.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page3.iro: Iron and Golden Upgrades can be crafted with the lower tier of Upgrade as well as by killing Zombified Piglins in overworld.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page3.net: Diamond and Netherite Upgrades can be found inside of Bastions in the Nether.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page4.tex:
Part 2: Bosses 

 Content Lock introduces several challenging boss fights that will test your skills and strategy. Each boss has its own unique mechanics and attack patterns, so be sure to study them carefully before engaging in combat. Here are some tips to help you prepare for these epic battles:

1. Study the Boss: Before engaging in a boss fight, take some time to observe its attack patterns and abilities. Understanding how the boss operates will help you develop an effective strategy for defeating it.

2. Gear Up: Make sure you have the best possible gear before facing a boss. Upgrade your weapons and armor using the smithing table and enchant them with powerful enchantments to increase your chances of success.

3. Stock Up on Supplies: Bring plenty of healing items, food, and other consumables to sustain yourself during the fight. Consider bringing potions that can boost your stats or provide temporary buffs.

4. Use the Environment: Many boss arenas have environmental features that can be used to your advantage. Look for cover, high ground, or other strategic positions that can help you avoid damage and gain an edge in the fight.

5. Team Up: If you're playing in multiplayer, consider teaming up with other players to take down bosses together. Coordinating your attacks and strategies can make a significant difference in the outcome of the battle.

6. Stay Persistent: Boss fights can be challenging, and it's normal to face setbacks along the way. Stay persistent, learn from your mistakes, and keep refining your strategy until you emerge victorious.

By following these tips and preparing thoroughly, you'll be well-equipped to take on the formidable bosses that await you in Content Lock. Here are some of the bosses you'll encounter: 

 Iron Guardian 
 The easiest one of the bosses. A giant hunk of living iron that can easily knock you around as well as down. Despite its appearance it doesn't have much health and is quite slow, so focus on dodging its attacks and striking when yous see an opening.

Enchanted Witch 
 A powerful spellcaster that can summon minions and hurl devastating spells at you from a distance. Stay mobile and try to close the gap quickly to avoid getting overwhelmed by her magic. She will try to teleport away from time to time, so either stop the spell by attacking her or be ready to chase her down.

Death Rider 
 He rides an neigh invincible undead steed, which despite being a horse, is suprisingly slow. However, he makes up for it with high damage and health pool. Be ready to dodge its powerful melee attacks as well as keep an eye on his charges and teleporting attacks.

Zombified Piglin Princess 
 Master of both melee and ranged combat. Can easily approach you from any distance as well as target you with her wide array of fiery spells. Getting to meet her is a challange in itself, as before she notices your presence, you'll have to slay multiple waves of Zombified Piglins, so get ready for a tough fight.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page4.iro: Summoning item can be crafted using 8 raw iron and a furnace. Can be summoned only during the day in overworld.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page4.enc: Summoning item can be crafted using 2 spider eyes, 1 lapis lazuli, 1 amethyst shard, 1 bottle and an enchanted book. Can be summoned only in the overworld
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page4.dea: Summoning item can be crafted using 2 gold blocks, 1 bottle, jack-o-lantern and 2 rotten flesh. Can be summoned only during the night in overworld.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page4.zom: Summoning item can be crafted using 2 diamonds, rotten flesh, 2 blaze powders and a nether star. Can be summoned only in Nether Wastes biome.
content_lock:dialogue.tutorial.page5.tex:
Part 3: Mechanics 

 Content Lock introduces several new mechanics that add depth and complexity to the gameplay experience. Here are some of the key mechanics you'll encounter:

1. Stamina Management: Many actions, such as sprinting and attacking, consume stamina. Keep an eye on your stamina bar and manage it wisely to avoid becoming exhausted during critical moments. The weight attribute addtitionally reduces player's stamina and increases the time needed to recover from running out of stamina, which can make or break your build, so remember to level up your load.

2. Enemy Scaling: Some enemies can spawn in an enhanced state, which causes their stats to increase, as well es giving them powerful equipment and abilities. The chance of running across enhanced enemies increases along with progression, ensuring that combat remains challenging throughout your journey. Be prepared to adapt your strategies as you face more and more tough foes.

3. Food Healing: The hunger no longer exists therefore food can heal you directly. Many of the old foods, as well as some of the previously inedible items, now grant various effects upon eating, which along with multiple new meals which can be made, give you additional advantages in fights.

4. Status Effects: New status effects, such as Bleed and Corruption, can impact your gameplay. Learn how to manage and counteract these effects to maintain your advantage in combat.

5. Leveling System: As you obtain Experience Bottles, you'll have the opportunity to craft levels and therefore level up and allocate skill points to enhance your character's abilities during your sleep. Experiment with different builds to find the playstyle that suits you best, since you have unlimited chances to reallocate your points.

6. Sleep Mechanics: Sleeping in Content Lock comes with its own set of challenges, including potential nightmares and exhaustion from sleeping too many nights in a row. Plan your sleep schedule carefully to avoid negative consequences.

By mastering these mechanics, you'll be well-equipped to tackle the challenges that Content Lock has in store for you. Embrace the complexity and depth of the gameplay experience as you embark on your adventure.
content_lock:options.player.limited_boss: When enabled players that died near a boss go into spectator mode for the time it stays alive.
content_lock:options.player.corruption.d: Toggles the corruption status effect, which can become active after defeating the Wither.
content_lock:options.player.nightmares.d: Toggles the spawning of monsters if player tries to sleep in dark area or under clear sky.
content_lock:options.player.leveling.des: Toggle the display of leveling menu when players go to sleep.
content_lock:options.player.sleep_exhaus: Toggle the debuffs from sleeping too many nights in a row.
content_lock:options.player.clock_displa: Toggle clock icon when player has a clock in their inventory.
content_lock:options.player.boss_music.d: Toggle the music that plays during boss fights.
content_lock:options.player.disable_spri: Toggle the player's ability to sprint.
content_lock:options.enemy.customization: Toggle custom stats of mobs or some custom mob spawns during certain parts of progression (turning this option off is not recommended).
content_lock:options.enemy.scaling.descr: Toggle chance of enemies spawning as a stronger version of themselves based on progression.
content_lock:options.progression.nether_: Toggle players periodically taking fire damage in the Nether before killing the Wither.
content_lock:options.game.tick_speed.des: Change the speed at which plants grow and fire spreads (MineCraft default is 3).
